fields.description:
As Agile Boards are very easy to create, and as users are able to create so many of them so easily, our JIRA eventually has a large number of boards, many of which are no longer used or needed. 

As each board adds performance overhead to a number of operations, it would be prudent to trim down the boards that are no longer in use or no longer point to an active owner.

We'd like to have an interface where boards can be selected by bulk criteria and bulk-deleted as needed. Sample criteria would be last accessed prior to (time), owner not active in JIRA, underlying filter has been removed, and others.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an Agile Board;
# Click on "Configure" and in the "Swimlanes" tab choose "Queries";
# Create a couple of queries with this situation:
## In one of the swimlane queries, specify one condition (for example):
{noformat}
type = Bug
{noformat}
## In the other swimlane query, create a different condition which could be included in the one above (for example):
{noformat}
labels = "test"
{noformat}
## Be sure that you have at least one issue that fits for both conditions (in this case, an issue which is a Bug and it has the label "test").
## Place the "labels" swimlane in this test on the first position.
(i) Just like in this screenshot:
!2.png|height=100px!
# If you check the board now, you will see that the swimlanes are divided fine, just like in this screenshot:
!1.png|height=100px!
# Now, browse back to the swimlane configuration page and change the order of the queries, so the first condition fits in the order (in our example, the issue with the label is also a Bug, so it fits in the other condition as well), like this:
!3.png|height=100px!
# You will now see that the other swimlane was ignored and the issue (since it fits for both conditions) was then passed to the other swimlane, as we can see here:
!4.png|height=100px!

h3. Current Behaviour

We've raised this as a bug because the user is not notified that the swimlanes will be merged, so this behaviour is not expected.

h3. Expected Behaviour

We have 3 options to fix this:

# Tell the customer that the issues from the swimlane will be merged into another one;
# Give the user the option to choose which swimlane he wants to use in case the issue fits for more than one;
# Keep the swimlanes as they were configured in the first place, not depending on the order.
fields.summary: Swimlane based on query reorganises itself depending on the order of the filters

fields.description:
Configuration for the Flagged field doesn't seem to be provided for Rapid Boards (Scrum/Kanban). Being able to configure the Flagged Field in the deprecated Classic Boards, posed a couple of advantages:
# Users could configure different types of Flags (as suited for their usecases)
# From the board configuration, it is easy to determine in which field the flag for issues are stored in JIRA.
# Although the flagged field is not Locked by default, if it was deleted, admins could easily create and configure a new one etc. 

Unfortunately, because this field is still unlocked by default, Rapid board users:
# Would often delete it and then wonder where all their Rapid Board Flags are being stored.
# Also, users who had been using their own/custom Flagged fields in Classic boards,  before migrating to Rapid boards are prone to be even more confused about this because there is no longer an easy way to determine where this Issue flag data is stored like there was in the Classic Board Configuration Screen and Project Template configuration for classic boards.

This 'Flagging issues' feature should be configurable to some extent atleast in Rapid Boards as well

fields.description:
We are looking for a way to be able to use the existing JIRA Agile "Work" view to see developer stories that are in progress/resolved/closed, but that aren't part of the current sprint, without being required to pull the stories into the current sprint (which affects our Burndown reports)

Currently (we are on JIRA Agile OnDemand) the JIRA Agile "Work" filter only allows viewing stories that are included in the current sprint.  If a developer wants to view/show other "in progress" (or resolved) stories they are working on, they are forced to pull the story into the Sprint, which can adversely affect the Sprint burndown report (adding the story causes the "remaining values" to spike up for non-closed issues).

It would be nice if we had some type of filter/toggle in Work view to enable displaying these stories on the board (we don't really care about the "to do" items, mainly the "in progress" and "resolved" ones).

Alternatively (if this was easier to implement), perhaps the Work view could be changed to allow the Sprint "selector" to change to a future sprint and/or the backlog so we could view in progress stories in that manner. (Currently it has an arrow that seems to indicate that it would display a selector, but this only shows us the sprint start/end dates and the "Complete sprint" button)

(This may be somewhat related to GHS-9723)

Hopefully I explained this clearly enough, if not please let me know if I can clarify what we're looking for.
fields.summary: As a user, I need the Agile board Work filter to allow viewing of in progress issues not in the current sprint

fields.description:
It seems that *JIRA's* Browse User [Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions] is ignored in *JIRA Agile / GreenHopper* Classic Boards when changed to [Assignee mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Classic+Planning+Board+Modes#UsingClassicPlanningBoardModes-Assignee]. This could lead to security issues.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

* Ensure that the user belongs to the respective _jira-developers_:
!browse_user_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Confirm on the *Browse Users* permission granted to the _jira-developers_ group:
!browse_user_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* Navigate to the *Classic Planning Board* and the *Assignee* mode is working as intended:
!browse_user_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* Remove the *Browse Users* permission:
!browse_user_4.JPG|thumbnail!

* Navigate again to the Planning Board and the user is still able to see the list of *Assignee* even though the *Browse Users* permission is already removed from him:
!browse_user_5.JPG|thumbnail!

Is this an intended behavior or is it a bug? Is the *Browse Users* permission independent between *JIRA* and *JIRA Agile / GreenHopper*?
fields.summary: Classic Board ignore the Browse Users Global Permission from JIRA

fields.description:
As a HuffPost product manager, I would like for tickets that roll over to return to the top of the backlog, not to the first open sprint. 

CONTEXT:
Because we have several teams, we usually have several sprints open (but not started). We also often have tickets that roll over to the next sprint. 

Currently when you close a sprint, any unresolved tickets are supposed to return to the top of the backlog. However, there's a bug in JIRA where the ticket is not returned to the _top of the backlog_ but instead is sent to the _first open, unstarted sprint_. The result is that, when closing sprints, we often add tickets to the wrong sprint and have to hunt for the tickets and remove them manually from those sprints. The hope is that the tickets would return to the top of the actual backlog. 

EC: When unresolved tickets roll over, return them to the top of the backlog, not to first open, unstarted sprint.
fields.summary: Tickets that roll over return to open sprints, not top of backlog

A value will be required by a future version of ActiveObjects.

...
{code}
* Doing a count, this dashboard load caused 134 of these WARNs

h4.Workaround

Reduce the logging level to from WARN to ERROR
# Shutdown JIRA
# Open {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}} in file editor
# Find and edit the following line
{code}
    log4j.logger.net.java.ao  = WARN, console, filelog

to

    log4j.logger.net.java.ao  = ERROR, console, filelog
{code}
# Restart JIRA

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a sprint
2. Add a bunch of issues to it
3. Close one issue.
4. Observe that the issue is no longer listed in the sprint in plan mode
5. Start the sprint and reload the page
6. Observe that the issue is now listed in the sprint

Expected behavior, started and unstarted sprints should have consistent issue sets being displayed.

Note: When issues are cloned, it is very easy to forget they are already in a sprint, then when you close them out, they disappear from the plan board. This makes clone centric workflows very susceptible to this.
fields.summary: Inconsistent issues displayed between started and unstarted sprints

The release screen gives no indication as to the previous "version", requiring us to check the versions tab of the project to confirm whether this is release 05 or 06, etc.

Displaying the previous version or couple versions on the release screen would give context to the next version being labeled.
fields.summary: The "release" screen from Kanban views should display the last n versions released

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Following a certain sequence of events causes JIRA Agile to submit the incorrect action ID to WorkflowUIDDispatcher.jspa and subsequently display an error that the Workflow Action is Invalid even when it is not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure the workflow and board as per the affected data.
# Create a new issue and drag it into a sprint.
# Create a sub-task.
# Close the sub-task and acknowledge the system message that the parent issue cannot be closed as there is no known transition.
# Transition the parent issue forward in the workflow.
# Attempt to transition it again.

h3. Expected Results

It transitions without fail.

h3. Actual Results

The "Workflow Action Invalid" error is displayed.

h3. Notes

Refreshing the issue and trying again as in the link will cause it to be successful.

An attached HAR shows the web calls the client is making - this appears to be a bug within the Javascript.
fields.summary: Dragging an issue on the work board displays Workflow Action Invalid when it is valid

fields.description:
When you run the following SQL it will return some issue IDs that are ranked by GH but that do *not* exist in Jira. 
{code:SQL}
select count(*) from "AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING" 
LEFT JOIN jiraissue ON "ISSUE_ID"=jiraissue.id
where 
("ISSUE_ID" >0) AND jiraissue.id IS NULL{code}

This potentially create some confusion among customers as it looks like there is some inconsistency in the ranking table. Ideally, JA should have a cleaning service to periodically cleanup those non-existing issue id rows.

(!) Note that there is *NO* functionality broken, this is just how the current issueranking table works.
fields.summary: Clean up for non-existence issue_id in AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING table

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

If the 'Rank' field is not using the appropriate case (for example, written as 'rank' instead of 'Rank'), sprints are not able to be created.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a board (or use an existing one), and create a new filter
# In the filter, make it use Rank, for example, "ORDER BY Rank" (use the autocomplete for the custom field in this filter)
# Make your board use this new filter, and check the sprint creation, it should allow you to create sprints
# Head back to your filter, and change 'Rank' to 'rank', so that it's now "ORDER BY rank". Once done, save it (the search results of the filter should be the same)
# In your board, you are no longer allowed to create sprints, the button is greyed out, and upon hovering over it with the mouse, it states 'The board must be ordered by Rank to create a sprint'

A short screencast on how to reproduce this has been attached.

h3. Other details

* If the 'rank' field is changed back to 'Rank', everything works fine, and you are now able to create Sprints
* This was tested on JIRA 6.0, with JIRA Agile 6.2.2
fields.summary: Rank field is not case insensitive in Board filter

Basically, I had 22 points in the sprint when the sprint started, and then I added one story with 2 points. The scope change amount was shown as 18%, when it should be 9%. The logs confirm that the code is double counting this added issue.

To reproduce the problem, the issue that is added must have been created after sprint start, and it must have had its estimate applied before it was added to the sprint.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Planned/future sprints are showing up in other teams boards who are not recognizing the sprint and closing them on the other team.

Prerequisites:

Each project has a PM who looks after the backlog of their project, but they both have admin access between the two projects.

* Project A (PRJA)
** Contains Component 1
** Contains Issue PRJA-1
** Contains Issue PRJA-2
* Project B (PRJB)
** Contains Component 2
** No initial issues
* Agile Scrum Board 1
** Filter: project = "Project A" and component = "Component 1"
* Agile Scrum Board 2
** Filter: project = "Project B" and component = "Component 2"
** Contains a sprint called _*Halloween Sprint*_

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a sprint in *Board 1* called _*Sprint 1*_
** Add PRJA-1 to _*Sprint 1*_
** Add PRJA-2 to _*Sprint 1*_
# Move issue PRJA-2 to Project B (PRJB) / Component 2
** *PRJA-2* is now *PRJB-1*
# _*Sprint 1*_ will now appear in *Board 2*
# Move PRJB-1 to _*Halloween Sprint*_ in *Board 2*
# _*Sprint 1*_ will still appear in *Board 2* and show as empty (even though there is 1 issue in _*Sprint 1*_ on *Board 1*
# The PM for Project B is able to close out _*Sprint 1*_ on *Board 2* even though the sprint doesn't match any conditions to show on *Board 2*.
fields.summary: Sprint(s) showing on board(s) they are not part of by moving issue

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
JIRA Agile upgrade issues (from version 6.3.1 to 6.3.2.1).

Please note that the user did not tried to upgrade from 6.3.1 to 6.3.2 due known bugs mentioned [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9869] and [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.3.2.1+Release+Notes].

h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Upgraded from UPM 
2. JIRA started to be unavailable/unresponsive (for about 2 or 3 minutes after download progress bar disappeared from the screen)
3. In *catalina.out*, thrown the following stack trace:
{noformat}
Cannot get value from RestAwareField customfield_10512, exception: 'Rank index was requested before the plugin was upgraded fully'
2013-09-27 04:33:57,184 ajp-bio-8091-exec-1213 INFO vlalovic 273x334071x23 1nfzm2d 217.24.28.250 /rest/api/latest/issue/DNET-12 [rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder] Cannot get value from RestAwareField customfield_10512, exception: 'Rank index was requested before the plugin was upgraded fully'
2013-09-27 04:33:58,139 ajp-bio-8091-exec-1216 INFO vlalovic 273x334078x23 1nfzm2d 217.24.28.250 /rest/api/latest/issue/DNET-12 [rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder] Cannot get value from RestAwareField customfield_10512, exception: 'Rank index was requested before the plugin was upgraded fully'

Cannot get value from RestAwareField customfield_10512, exception: 'Rank index was requested before the plugin was upgraded fully'
2013-09-27 04:33:57,184 ajp-bio-8091-exec-1213 INFO vlalovic 273x334071x23 1nfzm2d 217.24.28.250 /rest/api/latest/issue/DNET-12 [rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder] Cannot get value from RestAwareField customfield_10512, exception: 'Rank index was requested before the plugin was upgraded fully'
2013-09-27 04:33:58,139 ajp-bio-8091-exec-1216 INFO vlalovic 273x334078x23 1nfzm2d 217.24.28.250 /rest/api/latest/issue/DNET-12 [rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder] Cannot get value from RestAwareField customfield_10512, exception: 'Rank index was requested before the plugin was upgraded fully'
{noformat}

4. JIRA stop / start solved all issues:
 * JIRA agile shows version *6.3.2.1* now
 * full indexing performed (just-in-case), and
 * integrity check passed (full)

h4.Finding
Both JIRA and JIRA Agile works fine (for now).

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user's configuration gets into a certain state it can cause creation of the Hour Burndown Chart to have a huge performance impact, significantly increasing the requirements of heap space, can overload the DBCP and cause JIRA to eventually crash with an OutOfMemoryError or DBCP timeouts.

h3. Verification

Thread dumps (as per [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump]) will contain the following stack trace:

{noformat}
"http-bio-12067-exec-8357" daemon prio=10 tid=0x000000005c732800 nid=0x1af6 runnable [0x0000000046429000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at sun.dc.pr.PathDasher.appendLine(Native Method)
	at sun.dc.pr.Rasterizer.appendLine(Unknown Source)
	at sun.java2d.pipe.DuctusRenderer.createShapeRasterizer(Unknown Source)
	at sun.java2d.pipe.DuctusShapeRenderer.renderPath(Unknown Source)
	at sun.java2d.pipe.DuctusShapeRenderer.draw(Unknown Source)
	at sun.java2d.pipe.PixelToParallelogramConverter.draw(Unknown Source)
	at sun.java2d.SunGraphics2D.draw(Unknown Source)
	at org.jfree.chart.renderer.xy.XYLineAndShapeRenderer.drawFirstPassShape(XYLineAndShapeRenderer.java:1038)
	at org.jfree.chart.renderer.xy.XYLineAndShapeRenderer.drawPrimaryLine(XYLineAndShapeRenderer.java:1021)
	at org.jfree.chart.renderer.xy.XYLineAndShapeRenderer.drawItem(XYLineAndShapeRenderer.java:911)
	at org.jfree.chart.plot.XYPlot.render(XYPlot.java:3738)
	at org.jfree.chart.plot.XYPlot.draw(XYPlot.java:3310)
	at org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart.draw(JFreeChart.java:1235)
	at org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart.createBufferedImage(JFreeChart.java:1409)
	at org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart.createBufferedImage(JFreeChart.java:1389)
	at org.jfree.chart.ChartUtilities.writeChartAsPNG(ChartUtilities.java:183)
	at org.jfree.chart.ChartUtilities.saveChartAsPNG(ChartUtilities.java:320)
	at org.jfree.chart.servlet.ServletUtilities.saveChartAsPNG(ServletUtilities.java:187)
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance with dodgy data.
# Access the Hour Burndown Chart as that particular user that is affected.

h3. Expected Results

The chart is generated as normal.

h3. Actual Results

Heap memory spikes, chart takes forever, instance can become unresponsive, DBCP can timeout. Catastrophic failure.

h3. Workaround

This can potentially be worked around by deleting the affected users' records from the {{propertyentry}} table.

h3. Notes

Given that the Classic Boards are now deprecated it is not expected that this bug will be fixed as the Rapid Boards do not cause this behaviour.
fields.summary: Generating the Hour Burndown Chart in Classic can cause the instance to die a slow, painful death

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Background: For those of us that either practice scrumban or happen to have a large backlog of stories, planning view is starting to become a very nice tool for keeping the backlog in order with it version and epic views (components missing btw). Plain kanban board forces you to use plain JIRA for planning, involving several workflow states and even several projects if you have several kanban teams.

Possible way to implement: Use the exact same approach as done for scrum, as it allows two different teams to work on same issue pools thanks to sprint assignment. However dates can be skipped as the sprint will basically never end, instead a normal kanban mode deploy is done from time to time, while people still continue to work on issues in progress.
fields.summary: As a Kanban user I want planning view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We utilize components in a jira project to identify different code repositories within the scope of one project. For example a project may have a front end JavaScript MVC application and a server side API as two distinct repositories. One may be released without the other and vice versa, so we created a board with two quick filters, one for each component. The problem is that when you view the board with a quick filter applied and they you hit the release link, the release modal opens and says that all of the tickets will be released, not just the ones currently on the board scoped by the quick filter. What I would expect is that when you release, you only release the tickets currently visible on the board.
fields.summary: Quick Filters should be applied to making a release
